comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Judging from www.answers.com/topic/felix-weingartner-classical-musician and www.freebase.com/view/en/felix_weingartner , I think this is Felix Weingartner. According to: www.naxos.com/person/Felix_Weingartner_32313/32313.htm An Austrian, Weingartner was principal guest conductor of the Boston Opera during 1911-14. According to: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_Weingartner "Weingartner was married five times, to Marie Juillerat (in 1891), Baroness Feodora von Dreifus (1903), the mezzo-soprano Lucille Marcel (1912; she died in 1921), the actress Roxo Betty Kalisch (1922), and Carmen Studer (1931)." So this is probably Lucille Marcel.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of June 24, 1921 has a brief obituary for Lucille Marcel. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30D11F73D551A738...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 24, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00B10FE345D13738... indicates that rumors were circulating that Weingartner would be the next German conductor at the Met.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
swanq:

Thank you for your detailed research on Mr. Weingartner and his wife Lucille Marcel. We will expand the record when we update.
